data.title: The best swimming lakes in and around Berlin
data.meta_description: We show you the best swimming lakes near you in Berlin
data.text:
Some say "life is better at the beach", Rausgegangen says: Berlin's lake district is the place where (sun)milk and honey flow. With SPF 50, are you coming to the best bathing lakes in Berlin? We have sorted them so that you can find all the beautiful bathing lakes near you. Reachable in a maximum of one hour by public transport :)

THE BEST SWIMMING LAKES IN BERLIN EAST

Other

Flakensee

This beautiful lake is 0.67 square kilometers in size and 8 meters deep. Despite boat traffic, the water is crystal clear and surrounded by trees. The sandy beach at Flakensee offers shallow areas for swimming, ideal for children too. A small snack bar at the campsite sells chips, bratwurst and drinks. There are good restaurants and boat hire facilities at the Woltersdorf lock, around 15 minutes' walk away. The lock operations are particularly exciting for children. Antiquarian bookshops and small stores invite you to stroll around, and the historic streetcar is an additional highlight.

Opening hours? Always open

WHERE? 15569 Erkner / Erkner connection

Other

Großer Müggelsee

A large sunbathing area with a beautiful sandy beach right by the water invites you to take a dip. Whether families, friends or couples in love - everyone will find the perfect spot for a day of swimming here. Both sun worshippers and lovers of the shade will get their money's worth here. There are also delicious fries here - the perfect refreshment after a long day of swimming!

Opening hours? Always open

WHERE? 12589 Berlin / connection to the Müggelsee lido

Other

Große Krampe

The Große Krampe, an idyllic lake in the south-east of Berlin, is a real insider tip for nature lovers and those seeking relaxation. Surrounded by dense forests and gentle shores, the lake offers a peaceful oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The clear water is perfect for swimming and boating, while the picturesque lakeside paths are ideal for relaxing walks and bike rides. A small beach area offers bathing fun, and the numerous shady spots under the trees are perfect for a picnic.

Opening hours? Always open

WHERE? 12559 Berlin / Connection Alt-Müggelheim

THE BEST SWIMMING LAKES IN BERLIN SOUTH

Other

Zeesener See

Lake Zeesen is hidden away in picturesque Königs Wusterhausen, south of Berlin. Surrounded by green forests and tranquil meadows, the lake offers the perfect backdrop for rest and relaxation. The clear water is ideal for swimming, fishing and boating, while the surrounding hiking trails are perfect for long walks and bike rides. The small sandy beach and the numerous shady spots on the shore are ideal for relaxed sunbathing.

Opening hours? Always open

WHERE? 15711 Königs Wusterhausen / connection to Zeesen station, Königs Wusterhausen

Other

Großer Seddiner See

The Großer Seddiner See, located in the southern outskirts of Berlin, is a treasure for those seeking relaxation. Nestled in a picturesque landscape of rolling hills and dense forests, the lake offers a tranquil atmosphere far away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The clear water is ideal for swimming, sailing and fishing, while the surrounding hiking and cycling trails are perfect for relaxing excursions. With its well-kept bathing areas and idyllic picnic spots, the Großer Seddiner See is the perfect destination for a relaxing day in nature. Here you can unwind and recharge your batteries.

Opening hours? Always open

WHERE? 14554 Seddiner See / Wildenbruch connection Postdamer Allee, Michendorf

THE BEST SWIMMING LAKES IN BERLIN WEST

Other

Krumme Lanke

Krumme Lanke is part of the Grunewald chain of lakes and has three official bathing spots, although the water in the two bays at the northern end is much shallower. The bathing spots are quite popular, which is why the sunbathing lawns fill up quickly, but the edge of the forest also offers spots for chilling out later.

Opening hours? Always open

Where? Krumme Lanke, 14163 Berlin/ U3 to Krumme Lanke (Zehlendorf)

Other

Lieper Bucht

Lieper Bucht is definitely one of the good-chill spots in Steglitz-Zehlendorf. A large sandy beach invites you to relax and leads directly into the cool water. There are also shady spots and a large sunbathing lawn near the shore.

Opening hours? Always open

Where? Lindwerder, 14193 Berlin/ Bus 218 to Lindwerder

Other

Großer Lienewitzsee

The Großer Lienewitz See, idyllically situated in the Potsdam forest and Havel lake area, is a great retreat. Surrounded by dense forests and peaceful meadows, the lake offers a picturesque backdrop for relaxing hours in nature. The clear water is perfect for swimming, paddling and fishing, while the quiet lakeside paths are ideal for long walks and bike rides. The secluded bays and shady spots under the trees are ideal for a picnic or a leisurely sunbath. The Great Lienewitz Lake is a wonderful place to get away from it all and enjoy the natural beauty of the region.

Opening hours? Always open

Where? 14552 Michendorf / Ferch-Lienewitz connection

Other

Groß Glienicker See

Surrounded by picturesque forests and gentle shorelines, this lake invites you to swim, sail and relax. The clear, clean waters and well-kept bathing areas offer ideal conditions for water sports and relaxation. Enjoy a walk along the idyllic lakeside paths or a picnic in one of the many quiet bays. There is also a playground for the kids :)

Opening hours? Always open

Where? 14476 Potsdam / connection to Kurpromenade

Other

Schlachtensee

The Schlachtensee lake in south-west Berlin is a great place for relaxation and leisure activities. Nestled in green surroundings, the lake offers clear water for swimming and rowing. For the more energetic, the surrounding paths are ideal for walking, jogging or cycling. Cozy shore areas also invite you to simply linger and picnic. The Schlachtensee is perfect for a short trip into nature, just a stone's throw from the city center. :)

Opening hours? Always open

Where? 14129 Berlin / Berlin-Schlachtensee connection

THE BEST SWIMMING LAKES IN BERLIN NORTH

Other

Großer Wukensee

The Große Wukensee, hidden in the north-east of Berlin, is considered by some to be the most beautiful lake in Brandenburg. With its clear waters, it is ideal for swimming, boating and simply hanging out on the shore. The surrounding forest paths are perfect for relaxing walks or a bike ride. Pack a snack and enjoy the day at this cool spot in nature, far away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Opening hours? Always open

Where? 16359 Biesenthal / Wukensee connection, Biesenthal

Other

Liepnitzsee

Check out the Liepnitzsee, a hot spot in the north of Berlin! Here you can cool off and enjoy the clear water. The lake is surrounded by dense forests, perfect for a relaxing break while hiking or cycling. Chill out on the shore or venture onto the water for a paddle or a swim. Pack your friends and make yourself comfortable for a day full of fun and pure nature at Liepnitzsee!

Opening hours? Always open

Where? 16348 Wandlitz / Brandenburg-Klinik connection, Bernau near Berlin

Other

Mechesee

This lake in Berlin is the perfect place to hang out and enjoy nature. Surrounded by green forests, Mechesee offers clear waters for swimming and relaxing on the beach. The lakeside paths are ideal for a relaxing walk or a bike ride with your friends. Put your favorite music on your headphones, grab your crew and enjoy a casual day at Lake Meche, where the city is far away.

Opening hours? Always open

Where? 16321 Bernau / Lobetal Church connection, Bernau near Berlin

Other

Wandlitzer See

Lake Wandlitz is really fresh, right here in Berlin. Chill out on the shore or go for a swim or paddle in the clear water. The surrounding area is full of green forests, ideal for a relaxing hike or bike ride. Pack your friends and enjoy the day at Lake Wandlitz.

Opening hours? Always open

Where? 16348 Wandlitz / Wandlitz connection

Other

Summter See

The clear water is perfect for swimming and boating. There are beautiful forest paths all around for walks and bike rides. Here you can enjoy nature to the full and escape the daily grind. Whether alone or with friends, Summter See promises a relaxing day in a picturesque setting close to the city.

Opening hours? Always open

Where? 16567 Mühlenbecker Land / Summt Seegarten connection, Mühlenbecker Land

FAQ

How many bathing lakes are there in Berlin?

Berlin is home to 3,000 lakes and over 30,000 kilometers of watercourses, making Berlin and the surrounding Brandenburg the region with the most water in Germany.

Which bathing lakes are there in Berlin?

From Wannsee to Müggelsee, via Flakensee and Schlachtensee - Berlin offers you a wide selection of beautiful bathing lakes in the surrounding area.

Which lake can you swim in Berlin?

In our article you will find our favorite swimming lakes in the area, all of which you can reach within an hour by public transport! <3
